preclusion: Students who are taking or have taken LL5096.
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Curriculum or its equivalent.
moduleDescription: The emphasis will be on the international and comparative aspects of the subject, including the international treaties in this area (Paris Convention; TRIPS; Madrid etc) and regional developments (eg the Community trade mark system in Europe, the harmonization efforts in Asean); inter-relationship between trade mark law and the law of unfair competition in civil law jurisdictions; different treatment by countries of topics such as parallel importation; protection of personality interests; dilution; protection of "trade dress"or "get up".
